DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location of the ileum from which the specimen was collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The final section of the small intestine._Relating to anatomy._A position within another named site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.: Mucous membrane.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A layer of areolar tissue beneath the mucous membrane: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.: Situated farthest from a point of attachment or origin, as of a limb or bone; or directed away from the midline of the body.: The final section of the small intestine.
